basics.name: Joshua Galeria
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I'm pursuing my B.S. in Computer Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024. I plan on becoming a Software Engineer in the near future.

work.summary: Robotic Hand-Eye Calibration to automate new methods of make (3D printing and cutting) for shoes
highlights: Researched eye-in-hand and eye-to-hand robotic calibration techniques to generate robot coordinate reference frame
Incorporated Pylon camera software with Python to automate image capture and save for post processing
Created agnostic robotic cell configuration including global camera, extruder, Aruco tag, and robot arm
Scaling automated calibration process and robotic cell to manufacturing line helps Nike move to zero waste

work.summary: Developing interface and controls for a mini-production MARS rover - Guidance, Navigation & Control Subsystem
highlights: Collaborated with 4 multidisciplinary subsystems for seamless rover integration through Agile development
Led web interface development using Robotic Operating System and ReactJS that handles rover navigation and controls
Implemented ROS packages in Ubuntu Linux environment to allow data transfer and point to point communication
Built ReactJS components displaying 4 camera feeds and controlling 6 motors in real time

work.summary: KnightLight Flask - REST API that automates penetration testing for Center of Medicare and Medicaid software applications
highlights: Developed in Agile and trained using GitLab pipelines continuous integration and continuous development
Built Flask application using Python that returns the security rating of the specific application tested
Created custom Docker image to efficiently containerize KnightLight software application
Demonstrated KnightLight Flask application and Docker tutorial to 70+ company employees and leadership

work.summary: Student led venture fund investing in UH affiliated startups
highlights: Managing team of 8 to conduct due diligence of startup company applicants to make $5000 investments

volunteer.organization: Engineers' Council at the University of Hawai'i
volunteer.summary: Leading committee teams of 5 planning 10+ yearly events with turnouts of 100+ students and faculty
highlights: Leading committee teams of 5 planning 10+ yearly events with turnouts of 100+ students and faculty
Hosted Fall 2022 NAESC West Regional Conference
